author: radekkapka
content:
Hey <@586161934425128960> , I just saw https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/557 and was about to implement this in Prysm, but I went through all POST endpoints and there are a few more where we send an array of objects, but which do not make use of `IndexedErrorMessage`:
- https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/prepareBeaconCommitteeSubnet
- https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/prepareSyncCommitteeSubnets
- https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/prepareBeaconProposer
- https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/registerValidator

I expect that you omitted them on purpose because we don't publish data here, only signal something to the BN? It could still be beneficial to returned the indexed error for more clarity on what's wrong. I can open a PR if you agree

author: nflaig
content: yeah omitted them because there isn't that much validation done on the submitted data, we mostly just make sure the schema of the data is correct but could still be useful to return which item was the issue. I've never seen those apis error though and there isn't much that can go wrong. Not opposed to adding indexed error though.

content: `registerValidator` will be hard I suppose since they main validation is done by the builder, we mostly just a act as a proxy
